alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Le Sueur (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:23PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Le Sueur and northeastern Blue Earth Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 722 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mankato, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Madison Lake around 730 PM CDT. St. Peter and Kasota around 735 PM CDT. Cleveland around 740 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Le Sueur, Le Center, Montgomery and New Prague. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 131 and 141. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 44 and 55, near mile marker 60, and between mile markers 79 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central, central and east central Minnesota.
